intro: Poecilanthe ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf poecilanthe, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pink flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
